body:
<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
Unable to create new `ObjectBuckets` because after upgrading from 1.2 to 1.3.0 rgw `targetPort` is not updated to reflect the [new default of 8080
](https://github.com/rook/rook/commit/f136105951bce432297a1a75d95e60d13566d706)

**Expected behavior:**
The rgw `targetPort` should update automatically or at least be mentioned in the upgrade documentation thus allowing OBCs to create new OBs

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Create an OBC on a cluster that has been upgraded from 1.2.x to 1.3.0 and see that the operator doesn't proceed beyond:
```...
2020-04-09 16:37:42.774636 I | op-bucket-prov: initializing and setting CreateOrGrant services
2020-04-09 16:37:42.774651 I | op-bucket-prov: getting storage class "rook-ceph-delete-bucket"
2020-04-09 16:37:42.781659 I | op-bucket-prov: Provision: creating bucket "local-developer-61d56600-085d-413a-a5bf-24bfce1d77f4" for OBC "local-developer"
2020-04-09 16:37:42.781689 I | ceph-object-controller: Getting user: ceph-user-b2izA5Nn
2020-04-09 16:37:43.141081 I | op-bucket-prov: creating Ceph user "ceph-user-b2izA5Nn"
2020-04-09 16:37:46.624465 I | op-bucket-prov: successfully created Ceph user "ceph-user-b2izA5Nn" with access keys
2020-04-09 16:37:46.624601 I | op-bucket-prov: creating bucket "local-developer-61d56600-085d-413a-a5bf-24bfce1d77f4"
```


**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.15.0-88-generic
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.3.0
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): 14.2.8
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.17.3
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): on prem
* Storage backend status:
```
# ceph status
  cluster:
    id:     834088cf-b9f4-4401-a0fa-7d3169051b4a
    health: HEALTH_OK
  services:
    mon: 3 daemons, quorum a,b,d (age 18h)
    mgr: a(active, since 6m)
    osd: 28 osds: 28 up (since 18h), 28 in (since 4w)
    rgw: 1 daemon active (cmt.ceph.object.store.a)
  data:
    pools:   7 pools, 304 pgs
    objects: 34.85k objects, 29 GiB
    usage:   117 GiB used, 135 GiB / 252 GiB avail
    pgs:     304 active+clean
  io:
    client:   37 KiB/s rd, 85 B/s wr, 37 op/s rd, 24 op/s wr
```
title: Operator unable to create new ObjectBuckets because rgw listening port changed
